text.0: Trying to keep up with #AHA20? Track our coverage of the most important studies: https://t.co/AAoQEE5LyA https://t.co/5PdSVL7Hwh
text.1: Patients with symptomatic, paroxysmal, treatment-naïve atrial fibrillation were randomized to antiarrhythmic drug therapy or cryoablation. At one year, there was a significant reduction in atrial fibrillation recurrence with cryoablation compared with drug therapy.
text.2: Semaglutide, a GLP-1 receptor agonist, is associated with higher odds of nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (#NASH) resolution in patients with stage F2 or F3 fibrosis, according to a phase 2 study published in @NEJM and presented at #LiverMtg20.
text.3: In this multicenter trial involving patients with paroxysmal atrial fibrillation, and no previous drug treatment, cryoballoon ablation resulted in a significantly higher percentage of patients with treatment success at 1 year than antiarrhythmic drug therapy. #AHA20
text.4: Being interviewed as a Black applicant at the medical student, resident, fellow, or faculty level involves a collision of microaggressions and feelings and experiences related to stereotype threat, tokenism, imposter syndrome, and homophily.
